abstract: Google has hired former entrepreneur William Maris to consider accelerating its efforts to invest in promising start-ups.
snippet: Google has hired former entrepreneur William Maris to consider accelerating its efforts to invest in promising start-ups.
lead_paragraph: Google has long invested in promising start-ups. So the news that the company was thinking about formalizing those efforts by creating a venture-capital arm, reported in The Wall Street Journal Thursday, was hardly surprising.
